result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Vandenheuvel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua D Vandenheuvel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua D Vandenheuvel was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua D Vandenheuvel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: AODA Proof of Completion - Jackie Nitschke Center (CONFIDENTIAL)
CONFIDENTIAL DOCUMENT - Proof of AODA Assessment

9:06 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court recites agreement - will plea to count 1 with a fine and costs, AODA and DNA sample and count 2 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:12 a.m.
